A learning platform that includes a chatbot represented by a small illustration of a smiling sun, Ed is being tested in 100 schools within the district and is accessible at all hours through a website. It can answer questions about a child’s courses, grades, and attendance, and point users to optional activities.. . .Whatever AI is actually good for, kids will probably be the ones to figure it out. They will also be the ones to experience some of its worst effects. “It is kind of a social fact of nature that kids will be more experimental and drive a lot of the innovation” in how new tech is used culturally,Mizuko Ito, a longtime researcher of kids and technology at UC Irvine, told me. “It’s also a social fact of nature that grown-ups will kind of panic and judge and try to limit.”The full article appears inThe Atlantic.CategoriesAcademicsHighlightInformaticsNewsRelated PostsView ICS Project Expo-nential GrowthNewsICS Project Expo-nential GrowthJune 27, 2024View Commentary: California’s public universities come through – at least for one family (EdSource)HighlightCommentary: California’s public universities come through – at least for one family (EdSource)June 27, 2024View Pride Month 2024: Supporting LGBTQ+ in TechNewsPride Month 2024: Supporting LGBTQ+ in TechJune 25, 2024View Best Master’s in Data Science for 2024 (Fortune)HighlightBest Master’s in Data Science for 2024 (Fortune)June 25, 2024View Students “Up their Game” for 2024 Beall Butterworth CompetitionNewsStudents “Up their Game” for 2024 Beall Butterworth CompetitionJune 18, 2024View Tracing the Network Traffic Fingerprinting Techniques of OpenVPN (Comms ACM)HighlightTracing the Network Traffic Fingerprinting Techniques of OpenVPN (Comms ACM)June 18, 20246210 Donald Bren HallIrvine, CA 92697-3425(949) 824-7427Like us on FacebookFollow us on TwitterFollow us on YouTubeAdd us on LinkedInFollow us on InstagramFooter NavigationDirectoryFaculty & Staff ResourcesFaculty & Staff PositionsEmergency PreparednessAccessibilityPrivacy PolicyUCI HomeUCI DirectoryCampus Maps© 2024 All Rights Reserved.
